Transnational Fascisms and antifascisms in the 1930s: In the years before the Second World War, Mussolini and Hitler were keen to export and legitimize fascism in Europe and elsewhere. Many fascist organizations took root around the world, with some achieving power and others remaining on the fringes of politics. In response, a variety of antifascist strategies and organizations emerged.In this course, we will examine how fascism and antifascism crossed borders, reflecting on where, how and why they took hold during the Great Depression.
